tool.name: GATK4 AUTO CollectAlignmentSummaryMetrics (Picard)
tool.description: - Produces a summary of alignment metrics from a SAM or BAM file.
tool.command:
#include source=$set_sections# #include source=$bam_index_pre_chth_req# @CMD_BEGIN@ CollectAlignmentSummaryMetrics #for $num, $txt in enumerate($optional.ADAPTER_SEQUENCE_rpt) #if $txt.ADAPTER_SEQUENCE --ADAPTER_SEQUENCE '$txt.ADAPTER_SEQUENCE' #end if #end for #if $optional.arguments_file --arguments_file $optional.arguments_file #end if
#if $optional.ASSUME_SORTED $optional.ASSUME_SORTED #end if
#if $optional.COLLECT_ALIGNMENT_INFORMATION $optional.COLLECT_ALIGNMENT_INFORMATION #end if
#if $common.COMPRESSION_LEVEL --COMPRESSION_LEVEL $common.COMPRESSION_LEVEL #end if
#if $common.CREATE_INDEX --CREATE_INDEX $common.CREATE_INDEX #end if
#if $common.CREATE_MD5_FILE $common.CREATE_MD5_FILE #end if
#for $num, $txt in enumerate($optional.EXPECTED_PAIR_ORIENTATIONS_rpt) #if $txt.EXPECTED_PAIR_ORIENTATIONS --EXPECTED_PAIR_ORIENTATIONS '$txt.EXPECTED_PAIR_ORIENTATIONS' #end if #end for #if $common.GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS $common.GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS #end if
#if $optional.HISTOGRAM_FILE --HISTOGRAM_FILE $optional.HISTOGRAM_FILE #end if
#include source=$picard_bam_input# #if $optional.IS_BISULFITE_SEQUENCED $optional.IS_BISULFITE_SEQUENCED #end if
#if $optional.MAX_INSERT_SIZE --MAX_INSERT_SIZE $optional.MAX_INSERT_SIZE #end if
#if $common.MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM $common.MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM #end if
#for $num, $txt in enumerate($optional.METRIC_ACCUMULATION_LEVEL_rpt) #if $txt.METRIC_ACCUMULATION_LEVEL --METRIC_ACCUMULATION_LEVEL '$txt.METRIC_ACCUMULATION_LEVEL' #end if #end for --OUTPUT $OUTPUT #if $common.QUIET --QUIET $common.QUIET #end if
#include source=$picard_ref_opts# #if $optional.STOP_AFTER --STOP_AFTER $optional.STOP_AFTER #end if
#if $common.USE_JDK_DEFLATER --USE_JDK_DEFLATER $common.USE_JDK_DEFLATER #end if
#if $common.USE_JDK_INFLATER --USE_JDK_INFLATER $common.USE_JDK_INFLATER #end if
#if $common.VALIDATION_STRINGENCY --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY $common.VALIDATION_STRINGENCY #end if
#if $common.VERBOSITY --VERBOSITY $common.VERBOSITY #end if

param.name: ADAPTER_SEQUENCE
param.label: Adapter_Sequence
param.help: List of adapter sequences to use when processing the alignment metrics.

param.name: arguments_file
param.label: Arguments_File
param.help: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line.

param.name: ASSUME_SORTED
param.label: Assume_Sorted
param.help: If true (default), then the sort order in the header file will be ignored.

param.name: COLLECT_ALIGNMENT_INFORMATION
param.label: Collect_Alignment_Information
param.help: A flag to disable the collection of actual alignment information. If false, tool will only count READS, PF_READS, and NOISE_READS. (For backwards compatibility).

param.name: EXPECTED_PAIR_ORIENTATIONS
param.label: Expected_Pair_Orientations
param.help: Paired-end reads that do not have this expected orientation will be considered chimeric.

param.name: HISTOGRAM_FILE
param.label: Histogram_File
param.help: If Provided, file to write read-length chart pdf.

param.name: IS_BISULFITE_SEQUENCED
param.label: Is_Bisulfite_Sequenced
param.help: Whether the SAM or BAM file consists of bisulfite sequenced reads.

param.name: MAX_INSERT_SIZE
param.label: Max_Insert_Size
param.help: Paired-end reads above this insert size will be considered chimeric along with inter-chromosomal pairs.

param.name: METRIC_ACCUMULATION_LEVEL
param.label: Metric_Accumulation_Level
param.help: The level(s) at which to accumulate metrics.

param.name: STOP_AFTER
param.label: Stop_After
param.help: Stop after processing N reads, mainly for debugging.

param.name: COMPRESSION_LEVEL
param.label: Compression_Level
param.help: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).

param.name: CREATE_INDEX
param.label: Create_Index
param.help: Whether to create an index when writing VCF or coordinate sorted BAM output.

param.name: CREATE_MD5_FILE
param.label: Create_Md5_File
param.help: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created. .

param.name: GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS
param.label: Ga4Gh_Client_Secrets
param.help: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.

param.name: MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM
param.label: Max_Records_In_Ram
param.help: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.

param.name: QUIET
param.label: Quiet
param.help: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.

param.name: USE_JDK_DEFLATER
param.label: Use_Jdk_Deflater
param.help: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output.

param.name: USE_JDK_INFLATER
param.label: Use_Jdk_Inflater
param.help: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input.

param.name: VALIDATION_STRINGENCY
param.label: Validation_Stringency
param.help: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program. Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.

param.name: VERBOSITY
param.label: Verbosity
param.help: Control verbosity of logging.

tool.help:
A command line tool to read a BAM file and produce standard alignment metrics that would be applicable to any alignment. Metrics to include, but not limited to:
- Total number of reads (total, period, no exclusions) - Total number of PF reads (PF == does not fail vendor check flag) - Number of PF noise reads (does not fail vendor check and has noise attr set) - Total aligned PF reads (any PF read that has a sequence and position) - High quality aligned PF reads (high quality == mapping quality >= 20) - High quality aligned PF bases (actual aligned bases, calculate off alignment blocks) - High quality aligned PF Q20 bases (subset of above where base quality >= 20) - Median mismatches in HQ aligned PF reads (how many aligned bases != ref on average) - Reads aligned in pairs (vs. reads aligned with mate unaligned/not present) - Read length (how to handle mixed lengths?) - Bad Cycles - how many machine cycles yielded combined no-call and mismatch rates of >= 80% - Strand balance - reads mapped to positive strand / total mapped reads
Metrics are written for the first read of a pair, the second read, and combined for the pair. Chimeras are identified if any of the of following criteria are met:
- the insert size is larger than MAX_INSERT_SIZE - the ends of a pair map to different contigs - the paired end orientation is different that the expected orientation - the read contains an SA tag (chimeric alignment)
